AAS 246 Press Conference - From Molecules to Molecular Clouds, Discoveries in the Milky Way



Astrochemistry


GBT



Our discovery of the seven-ring cyanocoronene in the Taurus molecular cloud was featured during the 246th Meeting of the American Astronomical Society held in Anchorage, Alaska. Click here to watch the video!



Jun 9, 2025














Cosmic Chemistry Breakthrough, Largest Aromatic Molecule Found in Deep Space



Astrochemistry


GBT



A team of chemists and astronomers have made a groundbreaking discovery in the field of astrochemistry: the identification of cyanocoronene, the largest polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) ever detected in space. This molecule, composed of seven interconnected…



Jun 9, 2025














Exploring the Molecular Universe with Spectroscopy



Spectroscopy


Space



As part of our celebration of National Space Day, Spectroscopy Online sat down with Gabi Wenzel to discuss how spectroscopy is being used to explore the molecular universe.



May 2, 2025














More cyanopyrenes in TMC-1!



Astrochemistry


GBT



We detected all three cyanopyrene isomers in the cold dark cloud TMC-1. Their observed abundance ratio of ~2:1:2 reflects the available carbon sites for CN addition to pyrene. We discuss this further in our recent article appearing in Nature Astronomy today.



Nov 5, 2024














Schadstoffe im fast leeren Raum



Zeit


German



The German newspaper Die Zeit featured our detection of interstellar 1-cyanopyrene. Read along for Sibylle Anderl’s take on PAHs in space: Bestimmte kohlenstoffhaltige Moleküle vergiften die irdische Umwelt - und kommen in überraschend großen Mengen im All vor.…



Oct 30, 2024














Une molécule détectée pour la première fois dans l’espace



Astrochemistry


GBT



Un groupe de chercheurs interdisciplinaire a annoncé, jeudi, la détection d’une molécule retrouvée pour la première fois dans l’espace. Cette découverte pourrait aider les scientifiques à comprendre la formation de notre système solaire et le développement de la vie…



Oct 24, 2024














Scientists discover molecules that store much of the carbon in space



Research


Technology



A team led by researchers at MIT has discovered that a distant interstellar cloud contains an abundance of pyrene, a type of large, carbon-containing molecule known as a polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH). The discovery of pyrene in this far-off cloud, which is…



Oct 24, 2024














CfA features 1-cyanopyrene detection



Astrochemistry


GBT



The element carbon is a building block for life, both on Earth and potentially elsewhere in the vast reaches of space. There should be a lot of carbon in space, but surprisingly, it’s not always easy to find. While it can be observed in many places, it doesn’t add up…



Oct 24, 2024

Technology

2-methoxyethanol is our new space molecule!

ALMA

title: matplotlib demo
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# from astromol import *
# make_mols_slide()

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Gabi Wenzel
text:
Research Scientist Department of Chemistry | MIT  Center for Astrophysics | Harvard & Smithsonian
Hi! I’m Gabi, an experimental physicist navigating life between the laboratory and space. My interest is in laboratory astrophysics and astrochemistry, meaning I work with molecules that are present in the interstellar medium, the space between the stars. Even though all molecules are beautiful, I have a favorite family called polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs). While I’m trying to understand their photophysics, relaxation channels, and possible formation pathways, I am especially excited about contributing to the efforts of detecting PAHs in space using high-resolution rotational spectroscopy in the lab and radio telescopes such as the Green Bank Telescope in West Virginia!
